title: Are rural women bearing the darkest side of AI training?
description: In rural India, thousands of women work as AI content moderators, reviewing graphic violence, sexual abuse, and hate speech to train global artificial intelligence systems. While tech companies rely on their labour to build safer online platforms, these hidden workers face trauma, emotional numbness, and limited mental health support.
content:
Long before an artificial intelligence system flags a violent video or filters explicit content from your feed, a human being has already watched it, frame by frame.
In small towns and rural India, thousands of women spend hours each day labelling so... [6574 chars]

description: Sebi Chairman Tuhin Kanta Pandey said the regulator is increasingly using artificial intelligence tools to monitor market misconduct, including insider trading, unregistered investment advice, and misleading financial promotions.
content:

title: OpenAI CEO calls AI water concerns ‘fake’

title: ‘A.I. Literacy’ Is Trending in Schools. Here’s Why.
description: Artificial intelligence companies are urging teachers to prepare students for an “A.I.-driven future.” What that means varies from school to school.
content:
Computer literacy. Internet literacy. Social media literacy. Mobile literacy. Virtual reality literacy.
Every few years, the tech industry introduces a new kind of product, then prods schools to teach millions of students how to use it.
The pitch to ... [1204 chars]

title: ‘A.I. Literacy’ Is the New Drivers’ Ed at This Newark School
description: Teachers say they want to equip high school students to drive artificial intelligence, rather than be mere passengers steered by chatbots.
content:
The first session of a new artificial intelligence class this month for high school seniors in Newark involved purely human intelligence.

title: How an 'Infinity Mirror' Device Could Help Solve AI's Biggest Problem
description: Artificial intelligence companies are spending billions on chips and infrastructure. Researchers think optical computing could help.

description: Jefferies in its latest report has revised downward its earnings estimates for the IT sector, citing structural changes driven by artificial intelligence (AI), which may significantly alter the traditional business mix of IT companies.
